page.title: 02Kielder Water: the dam
page.content: The great dam at the southern-eastern end of Kielder Water was built principally of{boulder clay}: some 5.3 million cubic yards. Close to the northern end of the dam is the {draw-off tower,}which is some 212 feet high, and also at the northern end of the dam is a 200 yard long{overflow {weir.}Whenever the reservoir reaches capacity level this overflow allows water to flow off into a stilling basin at the foot of the dam and from there into the{North Tyne.}These overflow works have been designed to cope with double the worst combination of flood conditions ever known to have occurred. Hydro-electricity from the dam installation is now being fed into the National Grid of the Central Electricity Generating Board.
